alert.note: Alert for Lonoke; Prairie; White (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 24 at 5:42PM CDT until March 24 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Lonoke County in central Arkansas... Western Prairie County in central Arkansas... Central White County in central Arkansas... * Until 845 PM CDT. * At 542 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Searcy, Lonoke, Hazen, Beebe, Ward, Bald Knob, England, Carlisle, Judsonia, Kensett, Higginson, Pangburn, Humnoke, Keo, West Point, Barrettsville, Thurman, McRae, Sylvania and McCreanor. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
